{{Infobox NCAA Basketball Conference Tournament | | Year=2010 | Conference=Big 12 | Division=I | Gender=Men's | Image= | ImageSize= | Caption= | Teams=12 | Arena=[[Sprint Center]] | City=[[Kansas City, Missouri|Kansas City]], [[Missouri]] | Champions=[[Kansas Jayhawks]] | TitleCount=7th | Coach=[[Bill Self]] | CoachCount=4th | MVP= [[Sherron Collins]] | MVPTeam=Kansas | Attendance= | OneTopScorer= | TwoTopScorers= | TopScorer= | TopScorerTeam= | TopScorer2= | TopScorer2Team= | Points= | Television= }} The '''2010 Phillips 66 Big 12 Men's Basketball Championship''' was the 2010 edition of the [[Big 12 Conference|Big 12 Conference's]] championship tournament held at [[Sprint Center]] in [[Kansas City, Missouri]] from March 10 until March 13, 2010. It was won by top-seeded [[2009-10 Kansas Jayhawks men's basketball team|Kansas]]. The all-tournament team consisted of Kansas' [[Sherron Collins]] and [[Cole Aldrich]], [[2009-10 Kansas State Wildcats men's basketball team|Kansas State]]'s [[Jacob Pullen]] and [[Denis Clemente]], and [[2009-10 Texas A&M Aggies men's basketball team|Texas A&M]]'s [[Donald Sloan (American basketball player)|Donald Sloan]].[http://www.kansascity.com/2010/03/13/1811107/big-12-all-tournament-team.html Big 12 all-tournament team], KansasCity.com, March 14, 2010. ==Regular season and tournament seeding== {|
